NAME.Nominative: Venerable Nikita the Confessor of Paphlagonia (â€ c. 838)

SAINT.LIFE: Born in Paphlagonia, during the reign of Emperor Nicephorus, governor of Sicily, he, seeing the vanity of the world, accepted monasticism and was tonsured in Constantinople. During the reign of Emperor Leo the Armenian and Theophilus the venerable Nicetas suffered for venerating the holy icons. He died around the year 838.
